result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor James Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Trevor James Wilson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State recites plea - nc to count 1 14 CM 333  - 4 1/2 mo co. jail credit 12 days time served  - costs
count 1 15 CM 110 - 4 1/2 mo co. jail credit 10 days time served consecutive - costs
15 CF 76 - sentence w/held 3 yr probation - AodA AND ANY FOLLOW THRU - absolute sobriety - dna sample & surcharge - costs - 10 days credit time served
15 CF 181 - Sentence w/held probation 3 years - no contact with Alicia taylor or elizabeth Duffy, TRW , TJW and EL W unless approved by DOC - Anger management - aoda and follow thru - absolute sobriety - costs and 24 days credit (consecutive to the 9 month misd. cases)
Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of Guilty to counts 1 in 14 CM 333, 15CM110,15CF76 and 15 CF 181.  Court finds defendant guilty to charges.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Bachman has nothing to add.  Defendant addressed the Court

COURT:  

15 CM 110:  4 1/2 months county jail with credit for 10 days time served consecutive to 14 CM 333 - court costs

Defendant Trevor James Wilson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14  CM 333, 15 CM 98, 15 CM 110, 15 CF 76 and 15 CM 215.  Atty Bachman jt. resolution and waived his right to a prelim on 15 CF 181.  State agrees.  Court advised the defendant as to his right to a preliminary exam.  Defendant does wish to waive his right to a preliminary exam.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim - finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 11:45 am.
